meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be pronounced.
meanings.sent1: Her name's pronounceability made it easy for everyone to say correctly.
meanings.sent2: The pronounceability of the new scientific term was challenging for the students.
meanings.sent3: The pronounceability of the tongue twister amused the children as they tried to say it fast.
meanings.sent4: The pronounceability of the foreign language sounded like music to her ears.
meanings.sent5: The pronounceability of the medical term helped the doctor communicate effectively with her patients.

meanings.definition: The ease or difficulty of pronouncing a word.
meanings.sent1: The pronounceability of the word 'antidisestablishmentarianism' is quite challenging.
meanings.sent2: She tested the pronounceability of the new vocabulary words with her students.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the pronounceability of some words in the English language.
meanings.sent4: The pronounceability of the ancient language added an air of mystery to the archaeological discovery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used tongue twisters to improve the students' pronounceability and fluency in speech.
